purpose.p: The Product identification assignment application module supports the requirement to apply an additional, or multiple identifiers to a product, product version or product view.

This module supports identification of products and parts of a product. Identification provides the constructs needed to apply an identification to a product entity, such as a part or breakdown construct. The identification is in the context of a person and/or organisation.
purpose.example: Example: The company who manufactures a computer will associate an originator's identity, a name, model number and serial number with the computer to enable identification. The actual media for displaying these codes will vary according to the context. The computer will have them attached as labels which may include some encoding such as bar codes. The configuration database will hold them digitally. The owners manual will be text, either as paper or as electronic information (on-line manual).
purpose.p: The Identification_assignment schema supports five entities; identification_assignment, applied_identification_assignment, identification _assignment_relationship, identification_location, and identification_role.
An identification_assignment is an association of an identification with product data. The assignment is made within a specified role.
The identification_role specifies the purpose of the association of the identification_assignment with the product data.
An identification_assignment_relationship relates two identification_assignment entity data types and provides an identification and description of their relationship.
The identification_location represents information about the location of the identification on the product.
purpose.example: Example: The serial number of the laptop computer is marked on the back casing.
Example: The version number of the software can be displayed by selecting the 'About your product' option on the 'Help' menu

uof.name: Product_Identification_Assignment
uof.description: The Product identification assignment UoF specifies the definitional information for the concepts of identifying products, product versions and product views.
